Un conductor apuñaló a otro y dijo que fue en defensa propia
02 Nov 2019, 15:15 by El Eco de Tandil

El conductor acusado de matar a otro a puñaladas durante una discusión de tránsito en la ciudad bonaerense de San Pedro aseguró que debió atacarlo porque había recibido doce golpes en el marco de la pelea que mantuvieron.

Argumentó que llevaba un cuchillo en su auto porque había ido a comer un asado con amigos, aunque esas afirmaciones no se condicen con lo declarado por testigos.
El acusado es Sebastián Dotti (29), quien al mediodía fue indagado por la fiscal de San Nicolás Viviana Ramos, que le imputa el “homicidio simple” de Elías Chávez (40), asesinado el sábado por la noche cuando viajaba con su familia a bordo de un Renault Megane.
El imputado admitió ante la fiscal que mantuvo un altercado de tránsito con Chávez cuando ambos circulaban por la calle Mitre, en el centro de San Pedro, y reconoció que previamente había cruzado varios semáforos en rojo.
Dijo que luego, a raíz de lo que había pasado, Chávez le cruzó el auto, bajó y le dio “doce golpes” que lo lesionaron.
“Por eso me tuve que defender y tomé un cuchillo que tenía en el auto porque había ido a comer un asado a una peña deportiva de Boca”, sostuvo el acusado, quien declaró acompañado del abogado Mauricio Gugger.
Según las fuentes consultadas por Télam, esta versión no se corresponde con lo declarado por testigos ni con las imágenes captadas por las cámaras de seguridad del municipio, que muestran que el ataque duró solo unos segundos y que Chávez no pudo haberle dado tanta cantidad de golpes.
De hecho, se aprecia cómo la víctima se acerca al auto y luego de dos cuchilladas, se aleja del vehículo y cae porque, según se pudo establecer después, había recibido una lesión importante que le perforó la arteria aorta.
Siempre según su versión, Dotti después fue hasta la casa de sus padres, donde abordó un remís que lo llevó a la vecina ciudad de San Nicolás y, luego, a Rosario porque un abogado le recomendó que se fugara.
Esta actitud del imputado impidió que se pudieran corroborar si realmente había sido o no golpeado y realizarle el test de alcoholemia, que hubiera sumado dos pruebas de interés a la pesquisa, remarcó un vocero.
En tanto, Dotti aseguró que antes del hecho había ido al asado de Boca Juniors, pero se está corroborando si luego concurrió a un bar llamado “Berlín”, ubicado en la calle 25 de Mayo de San Pedro, donde supuestamente mantuvo una pelea con un grupo de jóvenes donde fue lesionado y por ese motivo habría ido en busca de un cuchillo para vengarse.
Además, se está evaluando si se acepta o no como testigo a una joven que iba en el auto con él al momento del hecho, determinar su vínculo con Dotti y evaluar si pudo o no tener responsabilidad en el encubrimiento del homicidio. (Télam)
text:
One driver stabbed another and said it was in self-defense
02 Nov 2019, 15:15 by El Eco de Tandil

The driver accused of killing another stabbing during a traffic discussion in the Buenos Aires city of San Pedro said he had to attack him because he had received twelve blows during the fight they had.

He argued that he had a knife in his car because he had gone to eat a barbecue with friends, although these statements are not consistent with what witnesses said.
The defendant is Sebastián Dotti (29), who at noon was investigated by the prosecutor of San Nicolás Viviana Ramos, who charged him with the “simple homicide” of Elías Chávez (40), murdered on Saturday night when he was traveling with his family to board of a Renault Megane.
The defendant admitted to the prosecutor that he maintained a traffic altercation with Chavez when they were both driving along Miter Street, in downtown San Pedro, and acknowledged that he had previously crossed several red traffic lights.
He said that then, as a result of what had happened, Chavez crossed his car, got out and gave him "twelve blows" that injured him.
"That's why I had to defend myself and I took a knife that I had in the car because I had gone to eat a barbecue at a sports club in Boca," said the defendant, who declared accompanied by lawyer Mauricio Gugger.
According to the sources consulted by Télam, this version does not correspond to what was declared by witnesses or to the images captured by the security cameras of the municipality, which show that the attack lasted only a few seconds and that Chávez could not have given him so many blows .
In fact, it can be seen how the victim approaches the car and after two slashes, moves away from the vehicle and falls because, as it could be established later, he had received a major injury that punctured his aortic artery.
Always according to his version, Dotti later went to his parents' house, where he approached a remís that took him to the neighboring city of San Nicolás and, later, to Rosario because a lawyer recommended that he escape.
This attitude of the accused prevented that they could corroborate whether or not he had been hit and perform the breathalyzer test, which would have added two tests of interest to the investigation, said a spokesman.
Meanwhile, Dotti said that before the fact he had gone to the roast of Boca Juniors, but it is being corroborated if he later went to a bar called “Berlin”, located on 25 de Mayo street in San Pedro, where he allegedly held a fight with a group of young people where he was injured and for that reason would have gone in search of a knife to take revenge.
In addition, it is being evaluated whether or not a young woman who was in the car with him at the time of the act is accepted as a witness, determine her link with Dotti and assess whether or not she could have responsibility in covering up the homicide. (Télam)
